speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, why aren't you dressed?  It's four in the afternoon.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I've been workin' nights.  My body clock's off.  I'm eating bacon and eggs at night and drinking beer in the morning.  [_He pours himself a cup of coffee._]

speaker: Frasier
text: That's what you always do.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, but now I'm tired all the time.  [_He takes his coffee and sits in his chair._]

speaker: Daphne
text: There must be some way to end this fight with your boss.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's the problem?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, he wants me to date his sister and I won't do it so he's put me on graveyard 'til I cave.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, he can't do that.  Why don't you file a complaint?

speaker: Martin
text: I'd just as soon keep it just between the two of us.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Is this woman really so repulsive that you're willing to sacrifice all your nights just to avoid a date with her?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, let me put it this way: years of chewing tobacco have discolored her tooth.  [_He breaks out laughing._]

speaker: Martin
text: Someone left a book of one-liners in the lost and found. [_pointing to the television_]  Hey, Fraizh, there's your friend again.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Phil?

speaker: Announcer
text: :  [_from the TV_] ...Dr. Phil McGraw, in person.  [_The scene shifts to show the television.  Dr. Phil is on._]

speaker: Phil
text: I'll be talking about life strategies at the State Theater Friday through Sunday.  Come join us, it might just change your life.  [_Cut to - the living room._]

speaker: Martin
text: Now there's a doctor.  [_Frasier looks put out by this._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I never knew you were friends with Dr. Phil.

speaker: Frasier
text: Some years back we found ourselves running into each other at seminars and conferences.  He's an excellent therapist. We had a bit of a clash over ethics.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, really.  What did you do, sleep with a patient?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not MY ethics, his.  The man bilked me out of two hundred dollars in a card game.

speaker: Martin
text: He did not bilk you, it's called a one-eyed jack.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, there is one eye, but the other eye is there by implication!  Therefore, the hand should have been a do-over. And you can ask Niles about this too!  As far as I'm concerned, the man owes me two hundred dollars.

speaker: Martin
text: This guy is so cheap, he could squeeze a nickel 'til the buffalo chokes.  [_He laughs again.  Frasier and Daphne roll their eyes._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, exactly how old is this book of one-liners?

speaker: Martin
text: How old?  You're asking me how old?  Well, I'll tell you how old.  [_He picks up the joke book and opens it._]

speaker: Martin
text: 1956.  [_Frasier looks to Daphne, who's just shaking her head.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Frasier and Roz are at a table together._]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, Frasier.  Daphne told me all about Dr. Phil.  I can't believe you know him.  Do you think you can get me in backstage?

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I really hadn't planned on seeing him.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, jealous, huh?  That's okay, I understand.

speaker: Frasier
text: I most certainly am not jealous. The man happens to owe me two hundred dollars.

speaker: Roz
text: Right.  But you know who could help you with your jealousy? Dr. Phil.  He'd be like "So your jealousy of me has taken over your life.  How's that workin' for ya?"

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and I'd be like "Fine.  My money, sir."

speaker: Roz
text: Please?  Please do it for me, please?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right, all right.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, thank you.  [_She grabs her things and gets up._]

speaker: Roz
text: All right, I'll see you at work.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, okay.  [_She heads for the door and Gertrude brings Frasier's coffee over._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Here ya go.  I couldn't remember if you wanted it black or not, so I brought it both ways.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's very thoughtful of you.  Thank you.  [_He hands back the unwanted cup._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: No, you might as well keep it, you're payin' for both.  [_She walks off.  Daphne and Niles walk in and join Frasier._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Daph.

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, look who's here.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, isn't that adorable?  You see this couple, we've seen them in the park a few times.  They're so sweet together. We like to think of them as us when we're older.

speaker: Daphne
text: Look how old Niles still puts his jacket around old Daphne's shoulders.  [_The old woman kisses her companion._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, she's still a saucy little kitten.

speaker: Daphne
text: And I'll be he still rolls over in the middle of the night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, the picture is gotten, thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I think I've found old Frasier.  [_Daphne looks around._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yeah.  [_Frasier turns around to see an old man sitting on the window bench, knitting._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Well I hope the two of you will understand if, in future, I choose to knit scarves only for myself.  [_He gets up._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, come on, we were only joking.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I know, it's all in good fun.  Oh, Niles, I just remembered, I...

speaker: Man
text: Shut up!

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Man
text: Shut up!  We're trying to knit!  [_Frasier glares at the old man and walk out.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Dr. Phil comes backstage, wiping his brow.  There is loud applause from the auditorium.  Roz and Frasier are standing behind a security rope._]

speaker: Roz
text: Dr. Phil!  Dr. Phil, over here!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, please!  At least attempt to be cool.  Phil, Phil!

speaker: Phil
text: Well Frasier Crane, is that you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Most assuredly.

speaker: Phil
text: Oh, it's you all right.  [_He comes over and they pat each other on the back._]

speaker: Phil
text: So, how are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm fine, I'm fine.  How's Robin?

speaker: Phil
text: She's great.  Can you believe it?  We're goin' on twenty- seven years.

speaker: Frasier
text: Congratulations.

speaker: Phil
text: And how's Lilith?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we've been divorced now for ten years.

speaker: Phil
text: Congratulations.  [_The slap each other on the back again, laughing.  Roz reaches out and shakes his hand._]

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, I'm Roz Doyle, I'm Frasier's producer.  I just think you're wonderful, I think your show is great and you're truly a wise man, do you know Tom Hanks?

speaker: Phil
text: Uh, no.  But thanks for the compliment.  [_He motions to a security man._]

speaker: Phil
text: They'll come on through.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you, thanks.  [_He and Roz follow Phil across the backstage area._]

speaker: Phil
text: Come on.  So, Frasier, how's your show?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, huge.  Thank you.

speaker: Roz
text: We just added Spokane last year.

speaker: Frasier
text: And a station in St. Paul... has agreed to let me send them a tape.

speaker: Phil
text: Can you believe after all that time we spent in the seminars that we both turned out to be broadcasters?  Boy, those were some good times, weren't they?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, indeed they were.  Although... sometimes the fun and games were lacking in fun.

speaker: Phil
text: Are you still whinin' about that two hundred bucks?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's the principle of the thing!  I'll tell you what, I'll tell you what, why don't we just discuss it over dinner?

speaker: Phil
text: Love to, can't.  I am so busy: personal appearances and book signings and interviews.  I've got this agent that's got me goin' twenty five/eight.  In fact, speak of the devil, here she comes.  [_Bebe Glaser, Frasier's former agent, comes over and hugs Phil._]

speaker: Bebe
text: Phil, darling!  That was sensational.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe?

speaker: Bebe
text: Frasier!  And Roz too.

speaker: Phil
text: You guys know each other?

speaker: Roz
text: She's my agent.

speaker: Frasier
text: And she used to be mine.

speaker: Bebe
text: Phil, there's a swarm of reporters in your dressing room just waiting to talk to you.

speaker: Phil
text: I probably should be going, actually, but Roz, it was really nice to meet you.  And Frasier, tell you what, let's do e-mail.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.  [_Phil walks off._]

speaker: Bebe
text: Isn't he marvelous?  He's a cowboy wrapped in a genius wrapped in a dream... wrapped in another cowboy.

speaker: Roz
text: I cannot believe that I have the same agent as Dr. Phil!

speaker: Bebe
text: Actually, you don't.  Somebody as big as Dr. Phil needs all of my attention.  But rest assured you are being handled ably by an agent in whom I have the utmost confidence.

speaker: Roz
text: Who is it?

speaker: Bebe
text: I want to say Tim...

speaker: Roz
text: I think I need to make a phone call.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.  [_She rushes off._]

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Bebe.  However did you land Dr. Phil?

speaker: Bebe
text: We met about a year ago a a charity donkey basketball game.

speaker: Frasier
text: Donkey basketball?

speaker: Bebe
text: Texas, darling.  It's like the symphony to them.  Long story short, I gave him some advice and finally he hired me full time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, congratulations.

speaker: Bebe
text: You can't imagine the connections I have these days.  If only you and I had... well, that's water under the bridge, I guess. It's fun catching up, but Phil's interviewing stylists for the Emmys.  Bye, Frasier.  [_She heads off as Roz comes back._]

speaker: Roz
text: What a phony, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_crestfallen_]  She used to be my phony.  [_He stands there in misery.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Frasier is on the couch, Martin comes in from the kitchen._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, do you think I did the right thing, changing agents? I mean, the one I have now is fine, but after I've seen what Bebe's done for Phil, I can't help wondering if maybe I've denied myself access to a wider world.  [_Martin stares at him, unfocused._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, are you all right?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  I haven't talked to anybody for a few days, it feels kinda strange.  Even this is makin' me a little uncomfortable.  [_He heads for his room._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you have got to stop with the graveyard shifts or you're going to start seeing apparitions.

speaker: Martin
text: No, don't worry about me, I'm pretty tough.  Listen, I'd love to stay here talkin' to you, but all this sunlight is makin' me dizzy.

speaker: Frasier
text: What, you don't like the sun?

speaker: Martin
text: Us night-shift guys call it "the scare ball."  [_He goes off to his room as the doorbell rings.  Frasier gets up and answers it to reveal Bebe holding a box._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Bebe.

speaker: Bebe
text: Hello, darling, I came across this old box of Frasier strategy memos and I thought I'd bring them by to you.  [_He takes the box and puts it down as she comes in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I didn't realize there was so much.

speaker: Bebe
text: And you thought I didn't work hard.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, now there's no need to take that tone, things have certainly worked out okay for you, wouldn't you say?

speaker: Bebe
text: Too true.  But I can't be blamed for being a bit of a bitter Bebe.  No one likes being tossed aside for a younger woman.  [_She sits on the couch._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Bebe, you know very well I only changed agents because you were ignoring me in favor of another client.  [_He sits down next to her._]

speaker: Bebe
text: I wasn't ignoring you!  I was only getting some much needed critical distance for a final glorious Frasierian push.  But let's not rehash the past.

speaker: Frasier
text: Agreed.  We accomplished too much together to stop being friends now.

speaker: Bebe
text: True.  Frasier, have you ever wondered what it would be like if I could apply what I've learned to you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes I have.  But it cannot be.  Can it?

speaker: Bebe
text: Dangerous thoughts.  You're a siren, luring me to the rocks. But I must resist or you'll hurt me again.  [_She rises and Frasier follows suit._]

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I'm no siren, I'm a man.  A man with ambitions.

speaker: Bebe
text: "Ambition."  The word is candy to me.  Damn you, devil-man, I must go.  I'm all confused and woozy...  [_She head for the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I understand.  But what about me?

speaker: Bebe
text: Very well.  Be at my hotel tonight for dinner.  Perhaps you'll show me just how serious you are.  [_She winks and exits to the elevator.  Frasier closes the door, a worried look crossing his face.  Fade out._]  _Act 2  Scene 1 - Cafe Nervosa_  [_Fade in.  Frasier and Niles are at a table._]

speaker: Niles
text: I think I figured it out: Bebe wants to have sex with a human male to bring about the Apocalypse.

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps.  But here's my theory: Bebe's had a thing for me for years.  This, coupled with the fact that control is an aphrodisiac for her, it's not surprising to find that she hopes to parlay her advantage into a sexual conquest.

speaker: Niles
text: But surely you don't intend to let the promise of wealth and exposure lure you into her bed.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's not gonna come to that.  It's all about the dance. It's all about the possibility of sex, the promise that's never delivered that keeps them tantalized.  One only needs to know how not to cross the line.

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me, but didn't you sleep with her once?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that's how I know where the line is.  I almost feel sorry for her.  Just another helpless woman suffering from an unslakable thirst for... Together:  Crane!  [_The clink their coffee cups._]

speaker: Niles
text: Still, I can't help thinking there's something Faustian about this whole thing.  [_Frasier laughs as he gets up._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Faust was a moron.  I'm gonna be a star!  [_He leaves, passing Daphne as she comes in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Daph.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello. [_to counterman_] A latte please.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Darling.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.  [_They kiss._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Did you see who's here?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  [_As they sit, they look over at the "Old Niles and Daphne" at the window seat._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I wonder if you'll still be stirring my coffee like that when we're in our golden years.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  And I know that a touch from you then will be just as sweet as it is today.  [_Another elderly woman (Mildred) comes in the door._]

speaker: Mildred
text: So this is where you've been going!  And with this tramp from water aerobics!

speaker: Old Daphne
text: Who are you?

speaker: Mildred
text: I'm his wife!

speaker: Old Daphne
text: You're married?!

speaker: Old Niles
text: I can explain!

speaker: Mildred
text: Don't bother, you worm!  [_She grabs him by the ear and drags him up._]

speaker: Mildred
text: You promised that was it the last time!  [_She slaps him on the back, pushing him out the door.  Niles and Daphne look very put off at this aspect of their "future selves."  Fade out._]   **IF AT FAUST YOU DON'T SUCCEED...** [_Soft singing can be heard.  There is a knock at the door and Bebe answers it._]

speaker: Bebe
text: Frasier, come in.  [_He enters._]

speaker: Frasier
text: How did you know it was me?

speaker: Bebe
text: I felt a certain tingle in the knob.

speaker: Frasier
text: Indeed.  Well, I see Phil has landed you in the lap of luxury.

speaker: Bebe
text: Yes, it's a lovely suite.  Unfortunately, there's some sort of choir championship this weekend and they practice at all hours.  [_She closes the drapes._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Is it Madrigal Madness already?  I had no idea it was this close to Whitsun.

speaker: Bebe
text: Please, darling, sit.  I'll pour the champagne.  [_Frasier sits down._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I suppose a drop wouldn't hurt.  So, you give any thought to taking me on again?

speaker: Bebe
text: Yes I have.  And I have to say there's almost nothing I'd enjoy more.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wonderful.  [_She hands him his champagne._]

speaker: Bebe
text: But first, let's talk about what I'd enjoy more.

speaker: Frasier
text: You want more than ten percent?

speaker: Bebe
text: I want you.  And "yes" to the other thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, Bebe.  I'm terribly flattered, it's just that, uh...

speaker: Bebe
text: Frasier, a few years ago I let down my guard and succumbed to your advances.

speaker: Frasier
text: You seduced ME!

speaker: Bebe
text: It changed me, Frasier.  If I crave your touch again, you've only yourself to blame.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not going to say that you're not a beautiful woman, but is it wise for us to jump into a relationship?  [_She starts running her hands over him._]

speaker: Bebe
text: I'm only talking about having a little fun.  After all, when I'm having fun, I'm happy.  When I'm happy, I work harder. When I work harder, you become famous and rich and powerful. That's what you want, isn't it?  Fame and power?

speaker: Frasier
text: I, I like to think of it more as influence, really, but...

speaker: Bebe
text: I'll bet I can make you bigger than Dr. Phil!

speaker: Frasier
text: Is that running water I hear?  [_She walks across the room and poses in a doorway._]

speaker: Bebe
text: Yes, I'm steaming the wrinkles out of a dress.  Does it put you in mind of a tropic night?  A moonlit stroll, the rhythmic lapping of waves against the shore...

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, if it's silk the steam could damage it.

speaker: Bebe
text: Wait right here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, I better open a window.  [_She heads into the bedroom._]

speaker: Bebe
text: Yes, darling, let the night in while I slip into something a little more comfortable.  [_Frasier opens the drapes, letting in a flashing red light._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if you want comfortable, how about that sweater ensemble I saw you in this morning.  [_He opens the window and the choir music grows louder, a low, somewhat ominous Gregorian chant.  Bebe comes in from the other room, dressed in a black nightgown, the steam billowing up behind her._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe...

speaker: Bebe
text: Join me, Frasier.  I'll make your dreams come true.

speaker: Frasier
text: But... at what cost?

speaker: Bebe
text: What I'm offering you is priceless.  Come, Frasier.  [_She beckons him with her finger and he steps into the bedroom, entranced._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I CAN'T!  [_He runs for the door, making panicked noises.  He pulls the door open, reels upon seeing that he's in Suite 666, then rushes out.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Martin is at the security desk, the time of 3:15 A.M. is down in the corner for a moment.  He lets out a sigh, then drums his hands on the countertop.  He gets into the drumming, finishing off by ringing the call bell on the counter.  Then he goes over and feeds a sheet of paper into the shredder.  He then pulls off his clip-on tie and feeds it into the shredder.  Fade out.  Fade in.  It is now 4:20 A.M.  Martin has made a lasso of an extension cord and throws it over a rolling chair, reeling it in, throwing it down, and "branding" it with his cane.  Fade out.  Fade in.  5:25 A.M.  Martin is sitting in the chair, holding a CO2 fire extinguisher.  He lifts the nozzle and points it away from himself._]

speaker: Martin
text: Roger, you are go for lift-off.  God speed, Martin Six.  [_He presses the handle and jets backwards across the floor.  Fade out.  Fade in.  5:29 A.M.  The timer bell goes off on the microwave oven. Martin pulls out a bag of popcorn that is slightly burned.  He makes a noise of pain and sets it down on top of the shredder bin, where it ignites the loose coils of paper.  Worried, he grabs the fire extinguisher and tries to put the flames out, but it's empty and he has to try to pound the fire out with the base of the extinguisher. Another security guard comes in._]

speaker: Supervisor
text: What the hell's goin' on?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez.  [_He grabs his tie and puts it back on._]

speaker: Martin
text: Just sort of a minor accident here.  But don't worry about it, everything's under control.  [_He turns back around and the other guard notices his ties is shredded. Martin has time for one quick guilty look just before the sprinklers go off._]

speaker: Martin
text: So, what time do you want me to pick up your sister?  [_His supervisor just shakes his head.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Roz and Frasier are sitting at a table.  Bebe comes in._]

speaker: Bebe
text: Well, if it isn't the first couple of radio.  I knew I'd find you here.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_]  Bebe, shouldn't you be in Los Angeles with Dr Phil?

speaker: Bebe
text: That's up to you, Frasier.  [_They sit._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't understand.

speaker: Bebe
text: Well, after our... meeting last night, I had to ask myself a very difficult question: Am I really that happy with Dr. Phil if I'm entertaining thoughts of returning to you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you saying you'll have me back?

speaker: Bebe
text: How could I refuse you?  Dr. Phil has been amusing, but I need a project.  I need a Frasier Crane!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's wonderful.

speaker: Bebe
text: Incidentally, Dr. Phil paid me fifteen percent.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, as will Dr. Frasier.  I've just got one very difficult call to make to my agent.

speaker: Bebe
text: Already handled.  I also took the liberty of calling Spokane, the terms of your deal there were worse than abysmal.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great, great!  You got me more money?

speaker: Bebe
text: No, they wouldn't budge, so you quit!  You're no longer on in Spokane, isn't it exciting?

speaker: Roz
text: Wait a minute, that is a step backwards!

speaker: Bebe
text: All the better to get a running start.  In my opinion, the future is firmly in front of us.  Congratulations, Frasier.  [_She rises, and Frasier gives her a hug goodbye._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you, Bebe, thank you so much.  I'll call you tomorrow.  [_She leaves._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, Roz, isn't that great news?  I feel as if a weight has been lifted from me.  Oh, it's marvelous!

speaker: Roz
text: She's charging you more money and we just lost Spokane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Big picture!  The future is firmly in front of me!

speaker: Roz
text: [_rising_] Isn't the future always in front of you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but not firmly!  [_He exits, leaving behind a worried Roz.  Fade out._] [_Fade in.  Bebe is playing poker with Dr. Phil.  She has a huge stack of chips compared to his._]

speaker: Bebe
text: Well, my little lamb has bleated back to me.  Frasier has rejoined the flock.

speaker: Phil
text: So my debt is cleared?  We don't have to keep pretending you're my agent?

speaker: Bebe
text: We're square, darling.  And maybe the next time you gamble with Bebe, you'll pay your debts with cash.

speaker: Phil
text: See, the problem is my wife looks at the bank statements and if she knew I was losing money playing cards, she would kill me.

speaker: Bebe
text: So, your wife doesn't know you play poker.

speaker: Phil
text: I don't tell her everything.

speaker: Bebe
text: I see.  And how's that workin' for you?

speaker: Phil
text: Just deal the cards.  [_He throws in his ante and she starts shuffling.  Fade out._]
